Interface IPlayer

All Known Implementing Classes:
AI, Player, PlayerAdapter
public interface IPlayer
Represents a generic player in the game. This interface defines the basic contract that all player types must implement, including making a move and providing a player name.
Since:
version 3.0
Version:
3.0
Author:
Juan Pablo Piedrahita Triana.
See Also:

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    getName()
    Returns the name or identifier of the player.
    boolean
    makeMove(int row, int col, Board opponentBoardModel, List<Ship> opponentShips)
    Executes a move (attack) against the opponent by selecting a target coordinate.

  • Method Details

    • makeMove

      boolean makeMove(int row, int col, Board opponentBoardModel, List<Ship> opponentShips)
      Executes a move (attack) against the opponent by selecting a target coordinate.
      Parameters:
      row - the row coordinate of the target cell.
      col - the column coordinate of the target cell.
      opponentBoardModel - the board model of the opponent (to register hits/misses).
      opponentShips - the list of ships placed by the opponent (to check for hits).
      Returns:
      True if the move results in a hit or false otherwise.

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the name or identifier of the player.
      Returns:
      the name of the player.
